comments.body: If you don't mind you could ask upstream whether they could include the license in the future. Not terribly important but they might not be aware of it.
Sure, I can open a pull request.

I created the patch 

```
From 7c1f3b35fe0e09835ce86508f7fcdfb18a252a05 Mon Sep 17 00:00:00 2001
From: Jan Janssen <jan-janssen@users.noreply.github.com>
Date: Sat, 16 May 2020 17:55:34 +0200
Subject: [PATCH] include license in pip Package

---
 MANIFEST.in | 1 +
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)
 create mode 100644 MANIFEST.in

diff --git a/MANIFEST.in b/MANIFEST.in
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..43a950e
--- /dev/null
+++ b/MANIFEST.in
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+include LICENSE.rst
```

Unfortunately the repository is archived/ read-only so I can not push it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +30,34 @@  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.rst
  summary: 'Writeable file object that atomically updates a file.'
